result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Alton Reese Jr.

records.addlTxt: Matter set for a Scheduling Conference on 12/19/2022 at 10:30 a.m.
Scheduling conference on December 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Matter set for a PTC on 10/31/2022 at 9:30 a.m.

9:25 AM Defendant Daniel Alton Reese Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Daniel Alton Reese Jr.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears on behalf of DA Louis John Molepske Jr. for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Kryshak filed a motion for bond modification.
Atty Kryshak makes his argument for the modification on the record.
ADA Pfeil would ask that the Court deny the request for the modification in bond and states his reasons on the record. 
Court questions the defendant's ties to Texas.
ADA Pfeil does not have any information with regards to this.
Atty Kryshak states that his client's family is here in Wisconsin.
Atty Kryshak makes further statements.

BY THE COURT:
Motion for Bond Modification is DENIED.
Bond is continued.
Filed by Atty Kryshak.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Court provides Atty Kryshak with a copy of the Information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:11 PM Defendant Daniel Alton Reese Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Daniel Alton Reese Jr.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy appears on behalf of DA Louis John Molepske Jr. for the State of Wisconsin. 

3:13 p.m.  Detective Justin Klein is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Cassidy.
3:23 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
3:24 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Kryshak.
3:27 p.m.  ADA Cassidy has no redirect.
Witness is excused.
3:27 p.m.  ADA Cassidy has no further witnesses.
Atty Kryshak has no witnesses and no final argument.
ADA Cassidy has no final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on June 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on June 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
to Amend Bond

5/9/2022 Bond amended to change the victim's initials from M.M. to M.N.

Do not possess weapons.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places: Victims referenced MN (changed from MM), KD, JP, DO, HE or confidential information #1 or SG.
If posted, Court requires not be released until functioning ankle bracelet can be fitted to him and arrangements for its monitoring is provided to the Sheriff.
Do not leave Portage County without prior court permission.
Surrender any passport he may possess.

1:41 PM Defendant Daniel Alton Reese Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Daniel Alton Reese Jr.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of WIsconsin.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  
Atty Mutchler would state that there is a correction on the bond for the victim as initials of M.N.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court adjourns this case to allow the defendant get an attorney from the public defender.
Bond is continued

Defendant Daniel Reese appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Louis Molepske  in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears in person on behalf of Defendant.
22PT519

1:05 PM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

State did file a bond probable cause statement to the Court.
State can address the facts for the anticipated charge of felon in possession of firearm.
Atty Molepske addresses the Court.

Atty Bergner addresses the Court regarding the facts, prior felony.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Atty Bergner states that Defendant is eligible for representation from public defender's office and one will be appointed.

State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner addresses the bond.
